revised_title: Water Structure and Transport in Single Cells: Osmotolerance and Adaptation Mechanisms
tldr: This article discusses the water relations in single cells of microorganisms and their ability to maintain growth under extreme environmental conditions. It explores the mechanisms by which microorganisms maintain a stable water content and the role of solutes in growth-limiting water activity. The article also examines the adaptation mechanisms, such as the accumulation of compatible solutes like proline, that allow microorganisms to survive in low water activity environments.
